title: VISIONSCORES - A SYSTEM-SEGMENTED IMAGE SCORE DATASET FOR DEEP LEARNING TASKS
author: Alejandro Romero Amezcua (Centro de Investigacion en Matematicas A.C.), Mariano Jose Juan Rivera Meraz (Centro de Investigacion en Matematicas A.C.)
relevance_why: The dataset created in this paper enhances machine learning applications in symbolic music processing, which aligns with current investigations into generative AI for music that Haohe Liu is exploring.
background: Creating a dataset that offers high-quality, structured images of two-handed piano scores to be used in deep learning tasks related to symbolic music processing.
contribution: This paper introduces the VisionScores dataset to solve the lack of structured image datasets in symbolic music processing, achieving a total of 24,810 annotated images.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous datasets focused primarily on Optical Music Recognition (OMR), which limited their use in broader music processing tasks and lacked dedicated segmentation features.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by providing a system-segmented dataset specifically designed for various machine learning applications beyond traditional OMR.

key_innovation: Establishes a dataset tailored to symbolic music generation and deep learning, with high structural consistency and detailed metadata.
real_world_impact: No immediate real-world impact, but it lays the groundwork for future developments in automated music generation and analysis systems.
limitations: The dataset's system numbering may not always align with actual scores due to errors in segmentation.

new_terms.Optical Music Recognition: **Optical Music Recognition (OMR)** is a technology that translates music notation images into machine-readable formats, similar to how Optical Character Recognition (OCR) works for text.
new_terms.system-segmented: **System-segmented** refers to the method of breaking down music sheets into manageable segments, or systems, each representing a set of musical staves.

open_sourcing: VisionScores is freely available in https://github.com/alroamz/VisionScores
